alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; York (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 28 at 6:35AM EDT until April 29 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg SC has issued a Flood Warning for the Broad River In SC Near Blacksburg affecting York and Cherokee Counties... .After a 4 to 5 inch basin wide rainfall, the Broad River has continued to rise all night and will go above flood stage this morning. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Broad River In SC Near Blacksburg. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...From 14 to 16 feet, Flooding of low-lying farmland along the river is ongoing. Areas along Buffalo Creek may be beginning to flood due to backwater effects. The Broad River may be flooding River Rd. and Little Hope Rd. near US 29. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 AM EDT Friday the stage was 15.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this morning to a crest of 16.6 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp
